sub_topic: Calculation of coefficient of performance of a heat pump
message_1: A heat pump has a coefficient of performance of 3.2 when operating between a cold reservoir at 5°C and a warm reservoir at 35°C. Determine the amount of work input required by the heat pump to transfer 1200 J of heat from the cold reservoir to the warm reservoir.
message_2:
The coefficient of performance (COP) of a heat pump is defined as the ratio of the heat transferred to the warm reservoir (Q_w) to the work input (W) required to transfer that heat:

COP = Q_w / W

We are given the COP as 3.2 and the heat transferred from the cold reservoir to the warm reservoir (Q_w) as 1200 J. We can rearrange the equation to solve for the work input (W):

W = Q_w / COP

Substituting the given values:

W = 1200 J / 3.2

W = 375 J

Therefore, the work input required by the heat pump to transfer 1200 J of heat from the cold reservoir to the warm reservoir is 375 J.
